null

The purpose of this project is to integrate Deaf culture, history, and the social implications placed upon Deaf communities around the world. Students will analyze and research famous Deaf individuals to understand their life events and why they became well-known in our society and community. Through this project, students will develop a stronger foundation and appreciation for the language they are learning by gaining a greater connection and sense of authenticity with the lives of Deaf famous persons.
name: "Famous Deaf Person" - Reflection Paper on Google.doc (Due Sept. 8, Friday at 11:00 p.m.)

discription:
Dear Class,

We go to St. Anthony's on WEDNESDAY, November 8th.  We will meet in 506 at 7:55 AM where I will take attendance.  Please do not arrive late -- we will leave without you!  Students who are late or not joining our trip will attend their regular school day, and must be in regular school dress code.  During Block 3, students attending the regular school day will report to the main office.

St. Anthony's Field Trip Dress Code: you may wear pants, jeans, or sweats, and T-shirts are fine.  No shorts, leggings, tank tops, bare midriffs, skirts, dresses, ripped clothing, sleeveless shirts, or open-toed shoes.  This is a food safety issue because many of us will be working in a kitchen!  No exceptions; anyone out of this dress code will not attend the field trip.

Lunch will be provided, and we will eat together.   You do not need to bring anything – all backpacks will be left in lockers at school.

After prayer, we will walk over to St. Anthony's together and I will assign you to specific groups.  We will return to SHC by approximately 2:00PM.  If you have a sports obligation that requires you to be back at school earlier, please let me know as soon as possible.

Looking forward to it!

Mr. Grace
name: Arrive to School Early!: St. Anthony's Trip

discription: Please read the article, "The Eucharist" from the Catholic Youth Handbook (p. 172-178). The purpose is for you to become more literate about a central Catholic practice rooted in the Last Supper and the Exodus experience and about its significance in Catholic spirituality, and to make personal connections. The Eucharist is the central ritual and reality in Catholic life. So it's important you take careful and thoughtful notes.
name: CH Article and Notes: The Eucharist (classwork and homework)

discription: Directions for your individual, summative reflection on the prayer project are attached. Please aim to submit this summative one week after you lead prayer.
